WorkflowTerminatedEventArgs Class

Definition

Provides data for the WorkflowTerminated event.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public class WorkflowTerminatedEventArgs : System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowEventArgs
Inheritance
Object
EventArgs
System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowEventArgs
WorkflowTerminatedEventArgs

Inherited Members

Empty
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()
WorkflowInstance

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

A workflow instance may be terminated in one of three ways: the host may call Terminate, a TerminateActivity activity may be invoked from inside the workflow instance, or the workflow runtime engine may terminate the instance because of an unhandled exception. When the workflow instance is terminated, the workflow runtime engine raises the System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.WorkflowTerminated event. The host may subscribe to this event by adding an event handler to System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.WorkflowTerminated.

Properties

Exception

Gets the exception that caused the workflow instance to be terminated.

public Exception Exception { get; }
Value
Exception

The Exception that caused the workflow instance to be terminated.

Remarks

When the workflow instance is terminated because of an unhandled exception, Exception contains the unhandled exception.

When the workflow instance is terminated by either a host call to Terminate or by a TerminateActivity activity, Exception contains a WorkflowTerminatedException that has its Message property set to a description of the reason for the termination. If the host terminates the workflow instance, it supplies this description in the string parameter to Terminate. If the workflow instance is terminated by a TerminateActivity, the description is supplied by Error.

Note

Although in the case of a System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.WorkflowTerminated event that is not due to an unhandled exception, the workflow runtime engine encapsulates a description of the reason for the termination in the Message property of a WorkflowTerminatedException, it does not necessarily throw this exception.
